medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic daily headache, fever, and myalgia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 6 months prior to admission with constant headache affecting both temporal and frontal regions. Accompanying symptoms included muscle spasms, generalized myalgia, weakness, fatigue, difficulty sleeping, and anxiety. The temperature rose daily, remaining below 37.8°C. Five months prior, the patient saw an internist, and physical examination was normal. Amitriptyline at bedtime was prescribed without improvement, and the patient took ibuprofen every 4 hours and oxycodone–acetaminophen intermittently, experiencing transient improvement in headache. Three months before admission, a CT scan showed increased density and possible thickening of the dural and subdural spaces along the frontal lobes. Night sweats, dry mouth at night, polydipsia, and polyuria were reported during follow-up evaluations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism developed more than 20 years earlier after an episode of hyperthyroidism. Previous mediastinal mass resection 23 years ago revealing caseating granulomas. Allergic rhinitis with immunotherapy for 2 years and history of a septoplasty. Tonsillectomy and appendectomy performed.
medical_history.family_history: Sister had thyroid disease; brother and child were healthy. No family history of headache, neurologic, or rheumatic disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lived in a rural area of Indiana until 3 years prior to admission, moved to New England. Travel history includes Mexico 2 months earlier and the southwestern U.S. 20 years ago. No exposure to tuberculosis.
